name: The Bendell Corporation
overview:
The Bendell Corporation is a British clothing, financial, entertainment, music, and production company. In its sprawling catalog, the corporation owns Bazaar Daily News (and all sister sites), Gladeon Entertainment, Elite-Life Management, Elite Publishing, and Gladeon Music Services.

The corporation coined its name from its once famously underage founder Derick Jacobs, the current C.E.O and longtime President. Bendell derives from the nickname ‘Baz Bendell’ given to Jacobs in 2010, by celebrity gossip blogs.

The Bendell Corporation, is estimated to have annual revenue in the neighborhood of $15million.

It’s newspaper Bazaar Daily News receives nearly 1million website visitors a month, making it the most popular teenage newspaper in the history of the internet. Despite the corporation’s obvious clout, its employees (and its founder) have remained in reclusive hiding for years, and are hardly ever seen in public.

The company has never actually released financial documentation of any kind. However, a leak by a former accountant suggests the organization is extremely wealthy.

In 2009, it was confirmed that the co-founder of a then Wallis & Holdings was found dead while on vacation in Los Angeles, California. It was after those events, that the corporation became reclusive.

The location of their office in London has never been revealed to the public.
